result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jonathan William Saban was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant to report to Probation by Wednesday October 14, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court notes 74 days credit against ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 3

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF212.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF212.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Maintain employment and/or school.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Mr. Puotinien.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-Court requests quarterly updates from the Diversion Program Coordinator.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Condition time, STAYED.
Concurrent with: Count 3

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Lundmark, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Stephen J. Dunlap DF: Jonathan William Saban appeared. Case called at 1:32. Includes 14CF84, 15CF212. Court quashes all warrants and authorizations. Atty. Dunlap updates the court, there is an agreement. There will be a DJOC on Ct. 1. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CF212 and G to Ct 2 and NC to Ct. 3. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF212 and withhold the entry of conviction and guilty of Ct. 2 and 3 in 15CF212. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 14CF84. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 

Count 2- W/H 18 months probation
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- 60 days condition time STAYED
- Court notes 74 days credit against any ultimate sentence.
- Costs and costs of supervision.
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and any recommended follow through. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- 60 hours of communtiy service. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Maintain employment and or school.
- No contact with Mr. Puotinien. 

Count 3-    
-Costs 
- All conditions of Count 2. 
 
DE to sign up for probation by Wed. Oct. 14 by 4:00pm. Bond continues until DE signs up for probation. 
Court request quarterly updates from the Diversion Program Coordinator.

Return on warrant at 10-15-2015 01:05 pm
